column4: Very frustrating... I might have to break down and by a regular DVD player instead of using the computer.
what's happening with libdvdcss for you?
I often get messages from totem saying the the disc appears to be encrypted.  The message often pops up after I've been watching the DVD for a while.
are you using totem-xine? Which version of libdvdcss do you have? I have 1.2.9 and I've not had any problems.
I'm using totem-xine, and libdvdcss2 version 1.2.5-1.  I'm using breezy.
You say that you get the error after watching the DVD for a while? Because that sounds like the drive is having trouble reading the disc

Yes, sometimes half-way through the movie, an error message pops up.  The strange thing is, if I use the controls to skip ahead of that point before the error occurs, I can sometimes watch the rest of the movie.
given that I'd almost guarantee that the disc has a scratch  on it that your drive can't correct/see through properly
you should consider cleaning them/and or your drive's lens
Hmmm... that could be, I guess. Now that I think about it, it has occurred more frequently with rented DVDs.
there is a more up-to-date libdvdcss available which you could install anyway, but I don't think it'd fix your problems
Any pointers to how to clean the drive's lens?
yup, you can buy a special type of disc with a small brush on it. You'd also get some cleaning fluid to put on the brush. Stick that in your drive and that's it cleaned
It's unlikely the lens is dirty though - almost certainly the disks are the problem
Well, I have one right here that I just tried to play, and it hung up at the menu...
Good call... this disk doesn't look too pretty.
Yup, diry disc appears to be the problem.  I wiped the disk with a damp tissue, and was able to get past the menu on the movie that just gave me an error.  I guess I should have checked that first...
Thanks for the tips.  I hope the rest of scratches and gunk on the disc don't cause more problems.  Lawrence of Arabia calls... ciao.
